title: O'Reilly - A Practical Introduction to React.js
description:
Learn how to use React.js to build faster, more testable web applications with fewer bugs. With this Oâ€™Reilly video course, experienced JavaScript developers will learn development principles of the React.js framework by diving hands-first into working examples. Youâ€™ll learn how to build isomorphic web apps that run on both client and server for lightning-fast mobile load times.
Veteran web developer Mike Sugarbaker guides you through development of a shopping list component with React, and then shows you how to expand this in-page widget to a full app with server-API interaction. These principles might make you uncomfortable at first, but youâ€™ll soon appreciate what React brings to the table.
- Set up a simple command-line workflow with JSX
- Learn Reactâ€™s lifecycle for managing a componentâ€™s creation, re-rendering, and destruction
- Understand the details (and perils) of using Reactâ€™s tools for giving components local state
- Interact with an API usingFlux pattern
- Learn how to run React code on the server as well as the client
- See two methods for making the server-side app respond to different URLs
- Get a sneak preview of the React Native project for producing native iOS apps with JavaScript
